intro: Oncostemum gracilipes, commonly known as the slender-stemmed oncostemum, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its slender, erect stems and small, showy flowers that are typically pink or purple in color. Its leaves are alternate, ovate, and have a hairy texture. Oncostemum gracilipes is often grown as an ornamental plant due to its attractive floral display and relatively low maintenance requirements.
